g.text: newly
created
VM
cloud
k8s
* nodePool
vms
vms
vms
AMI
snaphort and ami
Tqgs -
UUID-4
virtual nodepool use tags
scaling
controller
ksctl agent
ksctl mgt
can be CLI, UI
CM_(i)
CM_(ii)
CRD instead of CM for agent to look and see if any pending status has occured
custom kind will also avoid scanning entire confimap events in the cluster
also in future we might limit the resolved ones by deleting or keeping. a certain no of them
(ITS IMPLEMENTATION DETAIL so it can change)
store state.json to the configmap
and other metadata like clustername, region inside a sepeerate configmap and cloud tokens in secret better be a sealed secret
mgt can tell the ksctl agent by creating a configmap to write its latest state into it
once written and mgt will continuously pool for latest if found it will update its state
tell ksctl agent to scale down worker node -> 0
and then once done tell the mgt to destory
OR
events and agents
producer consumer
If we are going to try using nodePool
1. cloud provider supports
then use that also attach a tag or label to distringush between them
2. if doesn't we can create a tag or label which is unique to that specific cluster
(may be UUID version 4 can do) or SHA-1
so then use the virtual nodePool which we had it
Also another way to automate things
* try to make the AMI or a snapshort of the first workerplane
by that we can spawn up as many instances as needed
BEWARE: the token expires in case of kubeadm and k3s
Finally discussion and conclusion
1. auto-scaler
we will create a controller which willl detect any node pressure or Pod pressure if its due to any resources
then create a trigger scale up
we can create a crd which works just like the configmap which just stores data aka event
for example
i. if we have to scale up the cluster a new kind XyZ is created a resource which will have a status field to say if the event is has been resolved or unresolved
so if the event is not resolved it will be consumed
ii. producer can be the custom controller for the scaling up and scaling down
iii. consumer is the ksctl agent wihich will be getting any changes or creation of XyZ type of resource
if it finds one unresolved it works on that
iv. once got what to do ksctl agent will create a new VM and bootstrap the k8s distro
2. we need to develop the agent and event driven architecture first before moveing forward for any higher level features
as it will help use to easily tell the ksctl agent what needs to be done in the cluster
3. another thing we got was about 2 statefile so there are 2 ways to look at that
will use k8s event driven artecture to our advantage
4. anything we want the agent to do we can create a crd (need to limit the number of them to minimal)
for example:
if we decided to use point 3 i) do refer this
5. if we are going to build the custom controller we can didn't need to create the nodepool support
we can relly on the labels/tag in cloud to help us with that
6. also try to make the scripts non blocking and only make it a blocking when we are recieving data from the remote VM
for running true background task we might use `& disown` refer: https://github.com/kubesimplify/ksctl/issues/288
DISSCUSSION ON KSCTL
